hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Compression Breakout in Low-Float Alts
hypothesis_content.statement: When low-float altcoins (SKY, CRV, BAT) experience 5-day average volume below 50% of 30-day average while their 10-day price range compresses to ≤8%, a volume spike ≥2.5x 5-day average will trigger a directional move of ≥6% within 24 hours.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low float assets with compressed volume and price range represent coiled liquidity. A volume spike indicates new information or order flow entering, which disproportionately impacts price due to limited liquidity. The move tends to be swift and directional.
entry_conditions: Asset's 5-day avg volume ≤ 50% of 30-day avg volume
Volume spike ≥ 2.5x 5-day average on increasing price movement
Trade in direction of initial breakout (first 15 minutes)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% move against entry or volume drops below 1.5x 5-day avg within 2 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volume spike occurs but price fails to move ≥6% in either direction within 24 hours, suggesting absorption rather than breakout.
